description: Golden test cases for RAG evaluation

cases.title: High latency on checkout API
cases.description: We're seeing P99 latency of 5000ms on the /api/checkout endpoint. Normal baseline is 200ms. Started around 14:00 UTC. Approximately 30% of checkout requests are timing out.

cases.title: Payment service returning 503 errors
cases.description: CRITICAL: Payment service is completely down. All requests returning 503. Started at 09:15 UTC. Revenue impact confirmed. All 12 pods showing unhealthy status in Kubernetes.

cases.title: Canary deployment showing elevated errors
cases.description: New version 2.5.0 canary at 10% traffic showing 5% error rate vs 0.1% baseline. Errors are NullPointerException in UserService.getProfile().

cases.title: Database connection pool exhausted
cases.description: PostgreSQL connection pool at 100% utilization. New connections being rejected. Query queue backing up. Affects user-service and order-service.

cases.title: SSL certificate expired on API gateway
cases.description: SSL certificate for api.example.com expired 2 hours ago. All HTTPS traffic failing. Certificate monitoring alert was missed.

cases.title: Third-party payment provider returning errors
cases.description: Stripe API returning 500 errors for 40% of requests. Started 30 minutes ago. Fallback to secondary provider not configured.

cases.title: DNS resolution failures in us-east-1
cases.description: Intermittent DNS resolution failures for internal services in us-east-1. Affects 20% of cross-service calls. Route53 showing no issues.

cases.title: Configuration change broke authentication
cases.description: Recent config change to auth-service disabled OAuth validation. Users unable to login. Change was deployed at 16:00 UTC without review.

cases.title: Data inconsistency in user profiles
cases.description: Reports of user profile data showing incorrect values. Suspected issue with recent database migration. Affects approximately 5000 user records.

cases.title: Memory leak causing OOM kills
cases.description: Order processing pods being OOM killed every 4 hours. Memory usage grows linearly until hitting 4GB limit. Suspected leak in order validation logic.

cases.title: Slow API responses during peak hours
cases.description: API response times degrade from 100ms to 2000ms during peak traffic (12-14 UTC). Auto-scaling not triggering fast enough.

cases.title: Failed blue-green deployment
cases.description: Blue-green deployment of inventory-service failed. Green environment showing database connection errors. Blue still serving traffic.

cases.title: Redis cluster node failure
cases.description: One of three Redis cluster nodes failed. Cluster in degraded state. Cache hit rate dropped from 95% to 60%. Increased load on database.

cases.title: API rate limiting triggering incorrectly
cases.description: Legitimate API clients being rate limited. Rate limit counter appears to be shared across all clients instead of per-client.

cases.title: Unauthorized access attempt detected
cases.description: Security monitoring detected 10,000 failed login attempts from IP range 192.168.x.x in the last hour. Possible brute force attack.

cases.title: Kafka consumer lag increasing
cases.description: Order processing consumer lag growing at 1000 messages/minute. Consumer group appears stuck. Messages not being processed.

cases.title: Load balancer health checks failing
cases.description: ALB marking 4 of 8 targets as unhealthy. Health check timeout set too low for startup time of new instances.

cases.title: Terraform apply failed mid-deployment
cases.description: Infrastructure change via Terraform failed partway through. Some resources created, others not. State file may be inconsistent.

cases.title: Search service returning stale results
cases.description: Elasticsearch index not updating. New products added in last 6 hours not appearing in search results. Index lag of 25,000 documents.

cases.title: Mobile app API calls timing out
cases.description: Mobile app users reporting slow loading. API calls from mobile clients timing out at 30s. Web clients unaffected. Possible issue with mobile API gateway.
